Sentencas: Reversible solid oxide cells (rSOC) can convert excess electricity to valuable fuels in electrolysis cell mode (SOEC) and reverse the reaction in fuel cell mode (SOFC).
Titulo: Degradation study of a reversible solid oxide cell (rSOC) short stack using distribution of relaxation times (DRT) analysis

Sentencas: In this work, a five - cell rSOC short stack, integrating fuel electrode (Ni-YSZ) supported solid oxide cells (Ni-YSZ parallel to YSZ vertical bar CGO parallel to LSC-CGO) with an active area of 100 cm(2), is tested for cyclic durability.
Titulo: Degradation study of a reversible solid oxide cell (rSOC) short stack using distribution of relaxation times (DRT) analysis

Sentencas: The voltage degradation of the rSOC is 1.64% kh(-1) and 0.65% kh(-1) in SOFC and SOEC mode, respectively, with fuel and steam utilisation of 52%.
Titulo: Degradation study of a reversible solid oxide cell (rSOC) short stack using distribution of relaxation times (DRT) analysis

Sentencas: The post-cycle steady-state SOEC degradation of 0.74% kh(-1) suggests improved lifetime during rSOC conditions.
Titulo: Degradation study of a reversible solid oxide cell (rSOC) short stack using distribution of relaxation times (DRT) analysis

Sentencas: The distribution of relaxation times (DRT) analysis suggests charge transfer through the fuel electrode is responsible for the observed degradation.
